plugins.name: My Invoice
plugins.description:
I‚Äôve been creating invoices in figma using a simple template for long time. So, I thought what about creating a plugin of it. So here is my invoice - Now, easily create and customize invoices directly in Figma.


Very simple to use

  1. Add your details first (Name, studio, logo, payment details)
  2. Start creating invoice for client by filling the required information
  3. Create Invoice
  4. You can also enable disable some of the information from your profile (bank details, studio name, logo etc)


Upcoming Feature

> Use your own template

plugins.name: Fork Awesome Icon Set by Iconduck
plugins.description:
This Figma Plugin powers the Fork Awesome Icon Set open source library. It‚Äôs an icon library designed for mobile, desktop, web and print.


There are 811 icons included in this icon library, all of which can be searched through and added to your designs.


Popular Fork Awesome Icon Set icons:

  • Tool icons
  • Logos and brands
  • Star and interface icons


Plugin features:

  • Drag and drop any icons
  • Search through them instantly
  • Click any icon to add it your design
  • View search history
  • View embed history


Coming soon:

  • Save your favorite Fork Awesome Icon Set icons

plugins.description:
Introducing Nudge: Your New Design Superpower ‚ú®

Hey designers! Ever wish you could grab those stunning UI screens you find online and make them instantly editable?

With Nudge, now you can. We‚Äôve taken the hassle out of design inspiration and turned it into a tool you can actually work with. Think editable, customizable, and ready to roll ‚Äì straight into your Figma projects.


Why us?

Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll love:

* Editable Screens: Skip the grunt work. Take beautifully crafted UI screens and tweak them to match your creative vision.

* Completely Free: No paywalls, no subscriptions ‚Äì just pure design goodness, forever.

* For Learning & Growing: Whether you're exploring, experimenting, or prototyping, this tool is perfect for honing your skills.

* Save Time, Big Time: Forget starting from scratch. Get straight to the fun part ‚Äì designing.

* Non-Commercial Use: A tool built by designers, for designers. Keep it personal, keep it creative.


Perfect for Everyone

* Just getting started? Use editable screens to learn how the pros do it.

* Pro designer? Speed up your process without compromising your creativity.


Here‚Äôs How It Works:

1. Install the plugin on Figma (it‚Äôs super easy).

2. Browse through a library of editable UI screens.

3. Make it yours ‚Äì tweak, customize, and innovate!


Why You‚Äôll Love It

* Save hours recreating screens from scratch.

* Explore endless design possibilities.

* Focus on creating, not searching.


Join our community from here : Nudge

We'd love to hear your thoughts! For any feedback or if you spot bugs, reach out to us at ask@getcreatr.com


Let‚Äôs turn great ideas into even greater designs


Important Note üìù

Nudge is free and meant for educational and personal use only. It‚Äôs not affiliated with any third-party platform. Remember to customize the screens and play nice with copyright rules.

plugins.name: Acrolinx for Figma and FigJam
plugins.description:
Acrolinx is an AI-powered platform that eliminates content chaos and delivers strategy-aligned content, at scale.


Our technology captures the way your enterprise communicates, aligns your content with your guidelines, shortens your editorial process with automation, and analyzes the performance of your entire content operation.


Get customers faster, keep them longer, and reduce risks in communication.


As you write, the Acrolinx Sidebar guides you to create content that‚Äôs aligned with your strategy. Acrolinx ensures you‚Äôre using the words and phrases that are relevant to your company tone of voice and the audience you‚Äôre trying to reach. See where your content is strong and where it could be stronger with a detailed Acrolinx Scorecard and Analytics insights.


Acrolinx is not a stand-alone authoring tool. It‚Äôs an enterprise tool, which requires a paid existing Acrolinx account. If your company doesn‚Äôt have Acrolinx installed (or you‚Äôre not sure) we‚Äôd love to help you learn more.


Visit www.acrolinx.com to discover how you can supercharge your content.
plugins.tagline: This plugin adds the Acrolinx Sidebar to Figma and FigJam!

77223.release_notes:
In this release, we've improved how Acrolinx reads formatting for paragraphs and lists.

Improvements
More contextual information - The text content of Figma nodes now comes with more contextual information, including details about the structure of paragraphs and lists. We've updated Acrolinx to align with this and improve checking behavior. Get the updated Figma Content Profile to benefit from these changes.

plugins.name: Pikaso
plugins.description:
Determining the colours can be the most challenging thing to start a project, especially a project that begins only based on the logo provided by the client.


We believe that projects that start earlier will result in more explorable findings.


With current technology we can access the colour data on the picture. Combine that with simple and yet powerful AI algorithm to extract the right accurate colours.


With Pikaso, we hope that it can be a solution for everyone to start something faster and more efficiently. Please, feel free to give feedback and comment! We'd like to hear from you all!


Buy Me a Coffee: https://www.buymeacoffee.com/terimakasih

Saweria: https://saweria.co/terimakasihh

plugins.name: CopyCAT
plugins.description:
CopyCAT is a Figma plugin for effortlessly creating multiple variations of a design using a CSV file for data. This plugin is ideal for producing sets of similar designs with different content, such as business cards, social media posts, or product labels, or anything you want to really.


How to use:

  1. Design a template in Figma.
  2. Open the CopyCAT plugin and select the layer.
  3. Choose all the text layers you want to edit later
  4. Download the template CSV
  5. Add your data to the CSV and reupload it.
  6. Generate copies!


Watch this demo to get a better idea: https://www.loom.com/share/c99e3691aa734a35bffa5591890e410c?sid=508074d9-0c5b-4c76-aca6-d865ea25f176
plugins.tagline: A plugin to batch edit your design templates.

plugins.name: VRT
plugins.description:
Easily track changes across your entire Figma file and avoid accidentally breaking something.


Step 1: Snapshot your current file

The first thing you'll want to do is set your baseline. This will go through all of your pages and create snapshot images for each of them. If your file has many pages, you can select or deselect individual pages.


Step 2: Go make some changes

Once you've got your baseline snapshots set, go forth and make some changes. For example, you may be curious what will happen if you change a specific color. When you're finished, click 'Take Snapshot'


Step 3: Compare Results

At a glance, pages that have any visually noticeable changes will be shown as failed. The baseline snapshot is compared against the comparision snapshot to produce a diff image. Any changes will be marked red.


------------------------------------


Completely open source.

plugins.name: Print Resizer
plugins.description:
This plugin collects all components from frames in the current figma page and then copies and rearranges them into new printable frames. The printable frames can then be exported and printed on regular letter head. This plugin is especially helpful for frames with auto-layout since they can only scale in only one direction, making printing difficult.


Visit github for more information on how to use the plugin, how to report issues, and how to suggest further improvements.

plugins.name: Define
plugins.description:
Define takes a single layer/group/frame/component/instance, finds out what it contains and gives you the specs for all supported objects it finds. While Define works on complex objects with many nested layers, it works best if you use it to Define individual components.


Currently it reports the following specs:

  • Text layers: font family, size, line height, color and opacity
  • Shapes: corner radius, fill color, stroke color, stroke width, stroke alignment and opacity
  • Effects: drop shadow

plugins.name: PWA Icons And Splash Generator
plugins.description:
"PWA Icons and Splash Generator" is a versatile Figma plugin designed to simplify the process of creating Progressive Web App (PWA) icons and splash screens. With this powerful tool at your disposal, you can effortlessly generate all the necessary assets required to make your web application visually appealing, responsive, and ready for a wide range of devices.

Key Features:

  • Icon and Splash Screen Variations: The plugin allows you to generate a variety of icon sizes and splash screens, catering to different screen resolutions and device dimensions. It includes standard sizes commonly used for PWAs.
  • Custom Background Color: You have the flexibility to define a custom background color for your splash screens, ensuring they seamlessly match your app's branding and design.

Whether you're a seasoned web developer or a designer looking to streamline your PWA design process, this plugin empowers you to create a polished and professional user experience by simplifying the generation of icons and splash screens. It's an invaluable addition to your Figma toolkit for PWA design and development.

plugins.name: Bloq: Create, edit, and renew new/existing design systems
plugins.description:
üé® What is Bloq?


Bloq is a Figma plugin that revolutionizes how design systems are created and maintained.


It offers three major capabilities:

1. Generate an Entire Design System from Scratch

‚Ä¢ Get customized color palettes, typography, border radii, spacing, margins, and a fully variablized component kit ready to use.

‚Ä¢ Perfectly Integrates with the figma ecosystem and industry standard nomenclature.


2. Fix Existing Files or Frames

‚Ä¢ Automatically detect and assign brand guideline values to every component in your file.

‚Ä¢ Choose to fix specific modules, such as a selected screen or an entire page, according to your needs.


3. Create and Enhance Components

‚Ä¢ Scan entire pages to detect all major components, resulting in a new component kit made from the screens on the page.

‚Ä¢ Get all possible variants and states of components generated, with properties automatically assigned to their respective elements.



üò´ The Problem


Creating and maintaining design systems is painful:

‚Ä¢ Manually creating variables for colors, typography, and spacing takes hours.

‚Ä¢ Ensuring consistency across existing designs is tedious and error-prone.

‚Ä¢ Updating old files to match new brand guidelines is a nightmare.

‚Ä¢ Building component libraries and design kit from scratch requires weeks of work.



‚ú® The Solution


Bloq automates the entire process:

1. Input: Pick a figma file and run Bloq on it.

2. Analyze: Our AI examines your design patterns.

3. Generate: Get a complete, variablized component kit in minutes.

4. Update: Modify existing designs with one click.

5. Enhance: Generate complete component sets with variants automatically detected.



üî• Key Features


‚Ä¢ üé® Smart Color Palette Detection: Supports neutral and accent colors.

‚Ä¢ üìù Intelligent Typography System: Automatic style clustering.

‚Ä¢ üìè Automated Spacing & Border Radius Detection

‚Ä¢ üîÑ Bulk Update Capability for Existing Designs

‚Ä¢ ‚ö° Comprehensive Component Kits: Includes variants and component sets.

‚Ä¢ üéØ Flexible Fix Options: Fix a single frame or an entire page.



üí™ Perfect For


‚Ä¢ Design Teams: Launching new brands effortlessly.

‚Ä¢ Agencies: Managing multiple client design systems with ease.

‚Ä¢ Companies: Modernizing design infrastructure without hassle.

‚Ä¢ Time-Savers: Anyone looking to save hours on design system creation.

‚Ä¢ Efficient Creators: Building component libraries and kits without grunt work.



Ready to revolutionize your design workflow? Try Bloq today and experience the future of design system creation!
plugins.tagline: Create or fix the design systems in your files.

plugins.name: Tokens to Tailwind CSS
plugins.description:
This plugin generates utility classes for Tailwind CSS from design tokens set in the local style of Figma.


Instructions

  1. Create a local styles.
  2. Run this plugin.
  3. Select some options and press generate button.
  4. Copy and paste the generated code into the Tailwind CSS configuration file.


*Currently only colour styles are supported.


Options

„ÉªPrimitive colours

Generates the primitive styles referenced by the semantic style as CSS variables.


„ÉªClassify by keys

Classify by key if a special name is used for the first level of the style name.


Find out more:

https://github.com/K-shigehito/figma-tokens-to-tailwind#readme

plugins.name: Match Size
plugins.description:
Match Size enables you to easily make many objects in your design the same size.


How to use

  1. Install the plugin from Figma Community
  2. Select an object on your Figma design or FigJam canvas that is the desired size
  3. Open Quick Actions (Cmd ‚åò + K on Mac; Ctrl + K on Windows) and select Match Size > 1. Set
  4. Select the other object(s) that you want to match to the desired size
  5. Open Quick Actions and select Match Size > 2. Apply

plugins.name: Tangent
plugins.description:
Are you looking for a way to create stunning logos with the golden ratio? Do you want to snap and tangent circles and lines with precision and ease? If so, you need to try this plugin for Figma. This plugin allows you to draw and adjust circles and lines that follow the golden ratio, a mathematical proportion that is found in nature and art. You can also create tangent circles and lines that touch each other at a single point, creating a harmonious and balanced design. With this plugin, you can unleash your creativity and design logos that stand out from the crowd. Try it today and see the difference!


If you enjoy using this plugin and want to support its development, you can buy me a coffee. Your donation will help me to keep improving this plugin and adding new features. I appreciate your generosity and feedback. Thank you for choosing this plugin!

plugins.name: Localize
plugins.description:
Localize Your Figma Designs in Minutes


Let your designs speak for themselves. Effortlessly translate your Figma creations into other languages.


Showcase your designs in front of the largest audience possible. Localize seamlessly integrates with Figma allowing you to amplify your work‚Äôs impact by making it accessible to more people and languages.


Unlike run-of-the-mill translators, Localize offers designers an easy and elegant solution that:


  1. Takes the hassle out of internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n) processes
  2. Automates and streamlines localization workflows right in the design phase
  3. Reduces content translation complexities by eliminating the need for development resources
  4. Maximizes ROI by speeding up time to market


Localize empowers you to create globally-inclusive UI and UX designs, expanding the appeal and reach of your work by presenting them in the languages of your target markets.


Localization as easy as 1, 2, 3


  1. Install Plugin. Go to the Community section on Figma‚Äôs website. Select Plugins and use the search functionality to locate Localize. Select Install on the top-right corner of the Localize plugin page.
  2. Connecting to Localize. Once installed, access Localize via the Plugins dropdown.
  3. Enter your API Key. Start a Localize free trial or integrate with your Localize Business plan (or higher) by entering the API key.


I already have a Localize Advanced plan or higher account:


  1. Install the Localize plugin in Figma.
  2. Open your Figma file.
  3. Hover over Plugins in the toolbar. Select Localize.
  4. Type in your Localize API key. Select Connect.


I don‚Äôt have a Localize account yet:


  1. Install the Localize plugin in Figma.
  2. Open your Figma file.
  3. Hover over Plugins in the toolbar. Select Localize.
  4. Click the Start Your Free Trial link on the bottom of the login view.
  5. Create a Localize account and follow the Localize install steps.
  6. Return to Figma and type in your Localize API key. Then, select Connect.


If your organization doesn't have an Advanced plan, please click to upgrade your plan!


Need help?


For more information and to learn how to install the plugin, visit our Help Docs


Don‚Äôt have a Localize account? Try it for free!
plugins.tagline: Localize Your Figma Designs in Minutes

plugins.name: Maximum Override
plugins.description:
Compare objects to see what's different, then copy and paste the changes. Compare instances to their default main component and copy and paste the overrides.


Features

1. Copy and paste overrides between symbols


Two of Figma's greatest strengths are:


a. Overriding colors, text, and other properties on component instances, and

b. Swapping out instances of components, such as a icons or states.


But when you swap an instance, you lose all the overrides you've made, including changes to nested instances within a parent component.


Maximum Override allows you to copy your overrides, swap out an instance, and then paste the overrides back onto the new instance, to retain all of your changes. This includes nested instances that you've swapped with a different component.


2. Compare properties between objects


Maximum Override also allows you to select any two nodes on the stage and compare them against each other to see what's different. (In software, this is known as a "diff".) You can then copy the changes from object A to object B, or vice-versa. If you select a single instance, Maximum Override will compare it against its own main component.


------------


Bugs? Suggestions? Contributions? See the open-source project at https://github.com/CrookedGrin/maximum-override.

plugins.name: Color wheel
plugins.description:
A color wheel is a circular representation of colors, typically made up of 12 hues. It's a fundamental tool in many fields like art, design, and printing, as it helps us understand how colors relate to each other.


RYB (Red, Yellow, Blue): This is the traditional painters' color wheel used for mixing physical paints.


RGB (Red, Green, Blue): This is the color model used for displays like TVs and computer screens.


CMYK (Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Black): This is the color model used for printing.

plugins.name: Text Visual Alignment
plugins.description:
When working with typography in Figma you often have to manually move text layers and align them to the grid or ruler. This happens because of glyph sidebearings which create huge ‚Äúwhite holes‚Äù. It gets even worse if you have two text layers of different sizes. In this case the ‚Äúholes‚Äù become much more visible.


Our plugin compensates for the sidebearings and works with layers in two ways. Strict Alignment moves the text layer to the first visible pixel. It can be useful when you work with a group of single-line text layers. Optically Correct Alignment moves the layer to the sidebearing value of a straight glyph stem (Latin n/u, Cyrillic –Ω). You can use this option for multi-line layers, especially when the text is set in small sizes.
plugins.tagline: Quickly compensate for sidebearings in text layers to align them perfectly

plugins.name: Multipaste
plugins.description:
Multipaste

üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å•Û†ÅÆÛ†ÅßÛ†Åøüá∫üá∏Multipaste is a Figma plugin that allows for copy and pasting elements to many frames at once. No more pasting frame-by-frame! Use this plugin to boost your workflow.

__

üáßüá∑Multipaste √© um plugin do Figma que permite copiar e colar elementos para v√°rios frames de uma s√≥ vez. Chega de colar frame pro frame! Use esse plugin para acelerar seu trabalho.


Video demo: https://twitter.com/marceloblaz/status/1313321776865259520


Shortcut (for mac)

A simpler way to use plugins is by creating shortcuts. To create a shortcut, click on Figma at your system's navbar, then 'Services', 'Services Preferences', 'App shortcuts' and add a new shortcut for Figma. If you wish to use Multipaste with a shortcut, here is my suggested path:


For copying

Menu title: Plugins->Multipaste->Copy (‚åÉ‚åòC)


For pasting

Menu title: Plugins->Multipaste->Paste (‚åÉ‚åòV)


If you wish, you can also create a shortcut for clearing plugin cache by following the same procedure. Just switch the command and choose a shortcut.



What can this plugin do?

  • Copying multiple nodes, either nested in frames or in the page itself, at once and then pasting all of them into multiple frames or groups at once;
  • If any of the copied nodes is a component, it will create an instance of it and paste the instance, not duplicate the component;
  • Nodes that were copied from another frame will maintain its position in the new frame;
  • Nodes that weren't in a frame when copied will be placed in the center of the frames they get pasted into (same behaviour Figma already implements for copy/pasting).
  • NEW Multiple users may use the plugin within the same file without worrying about crossing plugin data.



What can't this plugin do?

  • This plugin won't work properly if you delete a copied node before pasting it first. It will still work for nodes that weren't deleted though.
  • This plugin doesn't access your system's clipboard, so you may not use regular copy/pasting commands to make it work;
  • This plugin doesn't allow pasting across different files.


Give feedback: https://forms.gle/azUS6mqaBypTTQG99

accepted.name: Marcelo Brasileiro
accepted.description: I'm a UX designer with frontend coding skills. I'm interested in helping products become more usable, inclusive, desirable and intelligent.

plugins.name: Mondrian Grid
plugins.description:
Mondrian Grid Generator is a Figma plugin designed to facilitate the creation of Mondrian-style geometric patterns.


It offers a set of controls for users to specify parameters such as grid levels, stroke thickness, and the ratio of cell division, enabling a wide range of design possibilities. The plugin produces a randomized, unique output within the user-specified constraints. It's particularly useful for designers seeking to quickly generate abstract, geometrically-structured artwork or backgrounds, in line with Mondrian's distinctive style, directly within their Figma projects.


How to Use


To use the plugin, select a frame and set the parameters. Increasing the levels parameter increases the number of cells in the grid. Stroke controls the thickness of the stroke and the split ratio slider lets you define how even you want the randomized cell division to occur.


Choosing a levels value of 2 can create distinct grids to use in presentation slides.


NOTE: Select an empty frame to run the plugin as it will remove all children objects present in the frame
plugins.tagline: Create abstract, geometric Mondrian-style grids with user-set parameters.

It's particularly useful for designers seeking to quickly generate abstract, geometrically-structured artwork or backgrounds, in line with Mondrian's distinctive style, directly within their Figma projects.


How to Use


To use the plugin, select a frame and set the parameters. Increasing the levels parameter increases the number of cells in the grid. Stroke controls the thickness of the stroke and the split ratio slider lets you define how even you want the randomized cell division to occur.


Choosing a levels value of 2 can create distinct grids to use in presentation slides.


NOTE: Select an empty frame to run the plugin as it will remove all children objects present in the frame

plugins.name: Restaurant Generator
plugins.description:
Restaurant generator allows you to populate your components with realistic, matching restaurant data. Simply name each of the layers by their supported data types and instant generate content for any component, frame, group, or layer. Supports multi-select and a hard coded set of restaurant data, but more to come!


For this to properly work, you need to name the field inside a component or group with the following options:

[data-name], [data-cuisine], [data-address], [data-cover]

plugins.name: Weather on Mars
plugins.description:
Creates new frames to display the latest weather on Mars

Weather data from InSight: Mars Weather Service API https://api.nasa.gov/assets/insight/InSight%20Weather%20API%20Documentation.pdf

NASA InSight is taking daily weather measurements (temperature, wind, pressure) on the surface of Mars at Elysium Planitia, a flat, smooth plain near Mars‚Äô equator.

plugins.name: Diagrammaton
plugins.description:
Diagrammaton converts natural language descriptions into fleshed out diagrams.


Rapidly and incrementally sculpt your unstructured ideas into logical, coherent foundations upon which great ideas can take root.


Getting started


Diagrammaton currently requires an OpenAI API key and a free license code from diagrammaton.com


  1. Sign up for an OpenAI account and generate a key ‚Äî here‚Äôs a guide
  2. Create a Diagrammaton account and generate a license code (requires Google sign-in)
  3. Run the plugin and paste your license code
  4. Create your first diagram!


Most diagrams have a common starting point. Here are some examples to get you started:

  • "An auth flow for a native mobile app that has OTP code verification, 2 factor, and optional biometric auth"
  • "A sign-up process that includes email verification, and profile setup"
  • "A typical mobile app sign in flow"
  • "A change management process for a design team working on a design system in Figma"



üëâ Read the Diagrammaton guide to learn more about the plugin and upcoming features
plugins.tagline: AI powered diagrams for FigJam

plugins.name: Selection Renamer
plugins.description:
Selection Renamer is designed to streamline your design process. Select a text layer, and the plugin will rename the top-level frame or section that the text resides in, using the content of the selected text. This makes renaming a quick and effortless task, ultimately saving you time and enhancing your workflow.


Instructions

  • Select text within a frame or a section
  • Hit ‚ÄòRun‚Äô on the plugin
  • Top level section or frame name renames to content from text selection.


Pro-Tip: You can select text layers contained in different sections or frames to bulk rename your frames or sections.


Additional links/resources

Loom Demo


How to reach out and support

plugins.tagline: Rename frames or sections with just a text selection.

plugins.name: MS Design Template
plugins.description:
This plugin creates an organization structure for our design team.

The limitations are that if you are not on our team you will probably have to rename the sections to something that makes sense to you.
